About the job At Google, we put our users first. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed. One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Youll work closely with teams on the production side of Google to further streamline and automate the end-to-end production journey for developers and embed well-lit paths that improve reliability and simplify Google-class server development. Youll also work closely with customers and partner teams across Google, so strong collaboration skills are essential. Google is and always will be an engineering company. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another. Work closely with teams on the production side of Google to further streamline and automate the end-to-end production journey for developers and embed well-lit paths that improve reliability and simplify Google-class server development. Work closely with customers and partner teams across Google. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law.

Head of Social Media & Digital Manager Group Communications (GC) is responsible for creating a lasting positive image of Roche and are representing the company's voice on a Group level: We communicate Roches strategy and how we deliver on our purpose of Doing now what patients need next to Roche colleagues and external audiences. We contribute to building trust of key stakeholders, to managing Roches brand and reputation and to building a favorable environment for our business. Our communications claim is ambitious and simple: We inspire the world about Roches contribution to peoples health. In this role you will: Work with a self-organizing agile team of social media managers to oversee social media activities and accounts to ensure high-quality and high engaging content and user experience Collaborate and design social media strategies to improve engagement and ensure brand consistency across all our social media channels globally Actively drive the social media part of the integrated communications campaigns Innovate social media communications Drive strategy and implement paid social media that enables coordinated and efficient use of paid campaigns by Group Communications, and the larger organization; be primary point of contact with agencies implementing paid campaigns Enable access to our corporate channels and others in the company, help stakeholders get their content on social in the right place and right format Provide counsel to teammates, Group Communications and the wider organization on social media best practices Create and drive a ambassador program for Roche employees worldwide in collaboration with the head of employee communications Who you are: You have a university degree or comparable experience in communications as well as significant experience in strategic communications in a fast paced environment. Additionally you bring the following skills and competencies: 10+ years of professional experience in corporate digital communications Experience developing, deploying and measuring the impact of digital campaigns for a large, global company Passion for digital and familiarity with current and emerging channels and technology including metrics and analytics Self motivated, able to thrive in a non-hierarchical, self-organizing environment, where teams form around projects and initiatives and approval comes from empowered product owners rather than line managers At least 5 years leadership experience in a global company Fluent in English Teamplayer and highly ambitious Roche is an equal opportunity employer.

This team is a unified, aligned team working together in the pursuit of common goals and in service to our associates, to bring the One Novartis experience to life. The team works to ensure associates believe in, stand behind, and are proud of our Novartis strategy and culture, both inside and outside our walls. This role in particular is part of the Oncology Associate Engagement team (within the larger AE team) and tells the Novartis Oncology story and its BOLD 4 Cure strategy, helping to ensure Novartis is “the place to be” in oncology. The Senior Manager in this team is a strategic thinker and storyteller, and makes a direct contribution to the team’s Big Bold Objective of telling the Novartis Oncology story so that associates are empowered, competitors emulate us, health care professionals respect us and patients trust us. They feel passion to get there (there is no better place to live their purpose than Novartis). They become ambassadors (all encompassing) for Novartis Oncology. Simple graphics and design experience Languages - English is a must; German is a plus Why consider Novartis? Imagine what you could do at Novartis! Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion: Novartis embraces diversity, equal opportunity and inclusion. Customer and Service Success Manager (gn) Location : Name Linked SoftwareONE, Leipzig, Germany Posted Date 12 hours ago(5/21/2021 6:41 PM) ID 2021-10470 Why SoftwareONE? SoftwareONE is a leading global provider of end-to-end software and cloud technology solutions, headquartered in Switzerland. With around 7,800 employees and sales and service delivery capabilities in 90 countries, SoftwareONE provides around 65,000 business customers with software and cloud solutions from over 7,500 publishers. You will have excellent skills at developing relationships which will allow you to understand the objectives and particular challenges of the customer organization to ensure they realize the full benefits of the MTWO solution and experience the highest levels of service and engagement with SoftwareONE. You will provide escalation management for Critical and Major customer Incidents and Service Requests keeping your customer up-to-date on resolution progress You will complete Root Cause Analysis of Critical and Major Incidents raised by the customer to optimize the experience for the customer and SoftwareONE. You will relay market needs and requirements back to internal SoftwareONE teams for future service and solution development You will mentor team members and assist them with their professional development You will provide input to account business plans to position SoftwareONE and MTWO appropriately You will provide thought leadership in highly complex projects/programs throughout the pre-sales and initial planning process You will possess a detailed understanding of the end-to-end onboarding process Through our internal training, you will be considered an expert on MTWO. Due to this new venture being a close partnership between SoftwareONE and RIB Software, your details may be shared between the two companies. You can read the data privacy statement of SoftwareONE here and RIB Software here. This is what makes SoftwareONE successful. What we expect from our employees Success at SoftwareONE is not defined by what you do for yourself, but by what you deliver for our customers, the business and for the employees around you. SoftwareONE employees are energized, agile and are laser focused on delivering world class Customer Satisfaction and results.

Location: Wallisellen, Zurich, Switzerland Start date: October 1st, 2020 Working hours percentage: 40-60% Internship duration: 12 months Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Responsibilities To be ready for what is coming, Microsoft is investing heavily in technically upskilling. The following areas are the main job activities you'll have as working student in the Customer Analytics & Compete sub-team: Compete market recommendations – analyze available compete market research data and based on that data conduct market research and analysis for Swiss market and propose recommendations for Compete activities across all Microsoft solution areas; Swiss compete orchestration – orchestrate Swiss compete execution activities, align different segments for compete motion; Customer research – provide insights on customer, by analyzing annual reports, as well as customer information available internally and externally; Customer insight orchestration – support Account Executives and Account Teams to perform customer value analysis, bringing together different parts of the internal organization. Qualifications You will be eligible for a working student internship at Microsoft only if you are pursuing a Bachelor's or a Master's degree in Business Administration, Consulting, Commercial, Finance, or other business related fields - ideally as a final year student; Passion for the technology; Knowledge or exposure related to the local IT market is preffered; Ability to manage numerous activities, prioritize and adapt to urgent operational needs; Comfortable working in a team as well as independently; Self-motivated, comfortable working with ambiguity and managing complexity in a global, fast-paced organization; Negotiation, customer service, and interpersonal skills; Well developed communication, presentation as well as analytical and problem-solving skills; Willingness and ability to self-teach; Fluent English and local language knowledge - German; Full unrestricted work authorization for Switzerland. Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

| Microsoft continues to invest over $1B per year in cyber security and research, to provide its customers with the solutions to confidently move to the cloud and modernize their platforms by delivering the security and compliance solutions, expertise and services needed to keep their data safe. The Specialist Enterprise Security manages the relationship with the CISO and compliance decision makers in Microsoft’s top accounts, drives revenue and market share by providing customers with insights and solutions that help them confidently and securely move to the cloud. Work across Sales, Product, Marketing, Partner and Services organizations to pull together offerings that promote the goals of accelerating customer adoption of the Microsoft Cloud, leveraging advanced capabilities of Windows 10, EMS, Office 365 and Azure, and utilizing Microsoft’s and partner services for assessments, monitoring and detection, and incident response. Qualify prospects into opportunities by using consultative approaches to demonstrate how customers can enable digital transformation through cloud solutions, leveraging Microsoft Security and Compliance offerings. Determine the appropriate solution bringing together Microsoft team members as well as partners. Ensure opportunities are accurately qualified and mapped to customer budget cycle, aligned with Account Teams Orchestrate both Customer and Microsoft key resources in a virtual team environment to define solution vision and achieve desired business outcomes. Manage the overall Security opportunity deal governance working with the customer’s CISO / Security team and the Microsoft local Account and Specialist Teams. Solid understanding of Microsoft Cloud offerings and / or complementing solutions. The position requires the ability to articulate and present the business value of Microsoft's solutions and have a firm understanding of Microsoft's strategies, together with security and compliance offerings relative to major Microsoft competitors. The candidate must be confident and capable of delivering readiness to sales audiences and be able to represent the Cybersecurity solution sales business locally inside and outside of Microsoft, as well as be able to speak as a subject matter expert (SME) at industry or customer events Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience required

Tu as la passion de la vente, du conseil clientèle et de l’aménagement intérieur  Tu aimes être en contact avec la clientèle et interagir avec eux d’une manière accueillante, attentionnée et inspirante   Tu prêtes une attention particulière aux besoins de la clientèle et fais de ton mieux pour lui proposer des solutions personnalisées et sur mesure   Tu souhaites contribuer activement au développement de tous les services disponibles dans le magasin pour aider notre clientèle à prendre de meilleures décisions et créer une expérience d’achat inoubliable   Tu établis des priorités et organises ton travail quotidien de manière efficace afin d’utiliser au mieux ton temps  Tu es disponible es as envie de travailler le jeudi ou vendredi soir (17:00-21:00) et tous les samedis  Tu as de bonnes compétences informatiques, tu parles couramment le français et tu possèdes également une bonne connaissance de l’anglais    TES RESPONSABILITÉS      Contribuer à créer une expérience d’achat extraordinaire chez IKEA et garantir la satisfaction de la clientèle   Approcher activement les clientes et clients afin d'identifier leurs besoins et les conseiller sur les meilleures solutions  Connaître et offrir aux clientes et clients la gamme complète des services disponibles en fonction de leurs besoins   Maximiser les ventes en veillant à ce que ta zone de responsabilité soit toujours propre, rangée et bien approvisionnée    A PROPOS DE CE SECTEUR D'ACTIVITÉ    Nous sommes celles et ceux qui rencontrent nos clientes et clients, dans nos magasins, en ligne, dans notre catalogue et ailleurs. Nous avons une bonne connaissance de l'assortiment IKEA, des marchés nationaux et des besoins de la clientèle et nous cherchons constamment de nouvelles façons de créer de vrais liens avec nos clientes et clients afin de maximiser les ventes et la rentabilité. Avec nos milliers de collègues à travers le monde, nous collaborons pour assurer la continuité du concept IKEA, afin de permettre à des millions de gens d'améliorer leur quotidien!

Take the next step in your career at ABB, working in a team that is dedicated to creating a future where innovative digital technologies allow greater access to cleaner energy. . Our mission Human Resources (HR) is to help ABB stand out when it comes to our people - from leadership, performance and talent management to rewards and career opportunity. You will be responsible taking care for HR master data domain with focus on strategic aspects, including owning ABB’s job architecture. You will be working closely with business regarding the impact of strategy, organization, processes, compensation and reporting on ABB’s master data model and will have overall globally accountable for HR master data governance, design, maintenance and implementation. You will also be responsible for the designing of ABB’s HR Master Data (MD) model in the context of globally implementing Workday for HR reflecting the ABB Way with fully revised job architecture and skills matrix. Your Responsibilities Owning and driving the maintenance of ABB’s HR MD Rulebook and of ABB’s job architecture for meeting the needs of the ABB Way based on the foundation defined by HRGT (2020/2021) and Workday’s HR data model (2022+). Functionally leading colleagues working on HR MD across ABB including development and operations and ensure that the area of responsibility is effectively organized, staffed, skilled and directed. Living ABB’s core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business. Join ABB and harness the power of our diverse global network, as you collaborate with and learn from our world-class teams. HQ Talent Acquisition Team ABB Asea Brown Boveri Ltd Let’s write the future. www.abb.com/careers We reserve the right to withdraw this posting at any time GBS HR Excellence

Du verfügst über Führungsqualitäten und bist motiviert, mit IKEA zu wachsen und in der Zukunft ein Team zu leiten. Ob im IKEA Restaurant, Schwedenshop, Bistro oder Mitarbeiterrestaurant: Du gehst aktiv auf deine Kundschaft zu und begegnest ihr immer mit einer grossen Portion Gastfreundschaft. Du trägst zum Geschäftsplan des Einrichtungshauses und IKEA Food bei und hilfst, diese Ziele umzusetzen. Gemeinsam mit deinen Vorgesetzten initiierst und ergreifst du Massnahmen zur Umsatzsteigerung und für ein noch besseres Kundenerlebnis im Bereich IKEA Food. In den IKEA Restaurants bedienen wir zusammen jährlich über 660 Millionen Kunden weltweit. Auch in unseren Bistros und den IKEA Schwedenshops bieten wir eine reiche Vielfalt an Lebensmitteln. Unser bunt gemischtes IKEA Food Team lebt und arbeitet nach dem Motto: Das Lachen klingt dort am hellsten, wo es etwas zu essen gibt!

About Swiss Re Swiss Re is one of the world's leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. You will be responsible for learning and development globally ensuring this is aligned to Swiss Re's strategy and business priorities. At Swiss Re we like to celebrate our achievements, and we have won many awards for our progressive learning approaches and you will have the opportunity to share and apply your passion to push the boundaries further. The team is located across several major Swiss Re offices globally and is often embedded into broader working groups in OPD, regularly working as part of agile teams on major deliverables. You are likely to demonstrate many of the following characteristics: Excellent understanding of and experience in 'new ways of learning' outside of traditional learning methodologies and approaches Sound understanding of progressive learning trends, digital solutions and technology supporting and driving learning Very open minded towards new approaches and ways of working Analytical mind who is digital savvy and understands how to achieve results through applying best in class digital solutions and technology Commercially focused and able to translate business strategy into relevant learning and development interventions well connected to wider HR solutions Ability to influence at a senior level in the organisation supported by excellent interpersonal and relationship building skills Great leadership and interpersonal skills in order to develop talent and to motivate colleagues across the globe to deliver at their best Learning agility is necessary to quickly understand the business which means specific insurance industry experience is not required Likely to have Master's degree level or higher professional qualifications in any subject connected to People and Development disciplines Swiss Re is an equal opportunity employer. Job ID: 33309 | Location: Pratteln, Canton of Basel-Landschaft, Switzerland Clariant’s Corporate Treasury is responsible for establishing an appropriate capital structure of debt and equity in order to fund the business striving the optimum balance between cost, risk and return. This translates into the need to ensure that at all times Clariant Group has the liquidity and cash to meet its obligations as they fall due, taking in funding from equity or debt capital markets activities, or bank borrowings, through day-to-day cash management and investments. We are looking for a highly motivated, dynamic Corporate Treasury Controller to join our Treasury Control & Cash Management Team based at our global headquarters in Pratteln, Switzerland, responsilbe for the three main areas: Reporting You will be responsible for the monthly financial reporting of FX results, Net Financial Income and cash and debt positions as well as FX transaction and translation exporsure or Clariant Shares Manage interfaces to various stakeholders, especially between treasury front & back office or banks Contact partner for internal and external audit involving Treasury topics Monitor internal and external financing structures, counterparty risk and credit rating Ensure compliance to policies worldwide, including providing best practice guidelines Set up hedge accounting and provide documentation FX and Pension Fund Controlling Monitor interest rate and foreign currency risk You will provide controlling and reporting for the Swiss Pension Fund as well as the International Pension Plans and taking on a further support function Prepae situational analysis of our pension funds supporting financial decisions Conduct monitoring & controlling of asset allocation, rules, investment policies and strategies Cash Management Act as contact person for all cash management related requests for the Swiss pension fund Take responsibility for liquidity management including cash pool coordination and short-, mid- and long term cash forecasting for the group in addition to related requests, netting and the SWIFT/banking interface Consult with finance colleagues in Headquarter and within the affiliated group companies and the shared service center organization Our Requirements University degree or equivalent education in economics with an additional qualification as Certified International Investment Analyst or CFA advantageous Experienced in financial asset management, financial and capital markets and in financial instruments Broad treasury experience within an international group, preferably within Corporate Treasury Experienced in treasury-related accounting and reporting with an understanding of cash forecasting techniques and consolidation Banking background welcome Interpersonal abilities and intercultural touch are highly welcome Strong readiness to invest and willing to go the extra-mile Team player with strong analytical skills, drive to be a constant challenger to the team Proficient use of SAP apllications including TRM, MS Office, especially Excel and PowerPoint and a sound knowledge of Power BI Excellent communication and negotiation skills in German and English Our Offer We ensure a highly interesting, versatile and challenging work environment You will have an outstanding influence on daily activities and tasks, with full responsibility assigned We offer attractive and performance-based remuneration and provide the benefits of a modern global company We will support your development needs with tailored, individual trainings Andrew Humphreys Regional Talent Acquisition Manager EMEA Phone: +49 619 6757-8912 E-Mail: Andrew.Humphreys@clariant.com #LI-AH1 Clariant is a focused, sustainable and innovative specialty chemical company based near Basel in Switzerland. Clariant’s portfolio is optimized for future growth, with a focus in three business areas: Care Chemicals, Catalysis and Natural Resources.

About the job At Google, we put our users first. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed. One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. You’ll work closely with teams on the production side of Google to further streamline and automate the end-to-end production journey for developers and embed well-lit paths that improve reliability and simplify Google-class server development. You’ll also work closely with customers and partner teams across Google, so strong collaboration skills are essential. Google is and always will be an engineering company. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another. Work closely with teams on the production side of Google to further streamline and automate the end-to-end production journey for developers and embed well-lit paths that improve reliability and simplify Google-class server development. Work closely with customers and partner teams across Google. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. In this role you will be responsible for the income tax returns of all Novartis Swiss entities as well as other Swiss related tax national or international forms. Operate as advisory for Swiss tax compliance matters, including M&A, restructuring and projects Your remit will be: Monitor national tax environment and align with local stakeholders to drive quality and ensure compliance with local tax laws, advise Group Tax Team on tax developments having an impact on compliance and disclosures Maintain and govern a good working relationship with tax authorities at cantonal and federal level Represent Swiss Tax vis a vis Swiss based business units and functions in the area of Swiss tax compliance Coordinate and align tax compliance matters with the respective stakeholders at HQ/Country level (such as Funds Flow, FRA, CFO, FSC, business unit, HR, Group Treasury...) Coordinate and review the tax calculations for Novartis Swiss entities Supervise the preparation and filing of income tax returns including alignment of positions with Group Tax and other stakeholders Determine and monitor tax payments, align with stakeholders (Finance, Treasury) Monitor the Swiss group internal movements from a TP perspective and align with the Group Tax TP Lead the discussion with the Swiss tax authorities in the framework of inquiries, audit, litigation Ensure at all times the bridging between IFRS, Statutory, Tax accounts, in all dimensions of P/L vs B/S, cash vs accounting and time dimension Responsible for the SOX filings in the area of Swiss Tax compliance Support Group Tax in the framework of Novartis disclosures (e.g .DAC-6, CbCR, OECD Pillar I and II, etc.) Monitor activities potentially impacting Swiss tax filings, including M&A, BD&, restructurings Act as an adviser to Group Tax, Finance and Business with respect to the opportunity, form and content of position papers Support the Swiss Tax Risk planning on all dimensions including Uncertain Tax Position (UTP) provisioning for Swiss matters and for global matters potentially having an impact on HQ Supports Group Tax and operations with financial data and information, including past events, available from Swiss tax compliance Assess intercompany relationships and guide Global Business Units to ensure compliance Review of business development deals, structuring/restructuring projects aligned with Group Tax and the Group tax strategy and assess impact on filings Support Swiss Planning when engaging with the tax authorities on planning opportunities, implemention of rulings Description du profil University degree or equivalent in Tax or Legal or Finance or Economics required - Additional qualification in a Tax or Finance related area (Tax Expert, Tax Lawyer, CTA) - Specific Tax Expertise relating to Switzerland - 5 - 7 years of tax practice: in big 4 firm (or equivalent), leaving as Manager/Senior Manager (experience as in-house tax manager a bonus) - German language skills essential - The ability to communicate English language skills also a must COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY & INCLUSION: Novartis embraces diversity, equal opportunity and inclusion. Other Job Details: Last Date to Apply for Job: February 18, 2021 Eligible for Employee Referral Bonus: YES Sunshine Act Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care providers name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. EEO & Employment Eligibility Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer.

| Today Lonza is a global leader in life sciences. In order to support our continued growth Lonza is seeking Bioprocess Engineers with a relevant background in Life Sciences and a passion for Biotechnology to join our talent community in Visp, Switzerland. As Bioprocess Engineer, you will ensure that operational activities for clinical and / or commercial manufacturing are performed on-time and within given safety and quality standards You will act as the functional lead for preparation, manufacturing execution, cleaning and changeover in the assigned area In upstream processing (USP), you will be in the lead in one or more defined USP areas (e. g. seed train, main cultivation or harvest) for the production of therapeutic proteins with either mammalian or microbial expressions systems (Bioprocess Engineer USP) In downstream processing (DSP), you will be in charge in one or more defined DSP areas (e. g. capture, polishing or filling) for the purification of therapeutic proteins from either mammalian or microbial cells (Bioprocess Engineer DSP) In the manufacturing of therapeutic BioConjugates like Antibody Drug Conjugates (ADC), you will be responsible for entire processes or process units for clinical and commercial manufacturing projects (Bioprocess Engineer BioConjugates) Master’s Degree in Biotechnology, Bio-chemical Engineering, Biochemistry or related Life Science subject, or Bachelor’s holder Knowledge in either USP (such as bioreactors) or DSP units (such as chromatography) Working experience in biomanufacturing would be an advantage GMP experience and understanding of bioprocess technology Excellent communication skills in English and / or German Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problem... Originele vacature is te vinden op StepStone.

Head of IS Operations and applications you will be responsible for SLA fulfilment, supplier sustainability/compliance, cash management and cost reduction with a TCO perspective; establish and run proper governance on strategic and operational level with relevant suppliers Your background Strong IT background and proven track record in comparable position of 5-10 years; experience in implementing applications like SAP, SAP BW, MS Dynamics CRM, CAx/PDM Relationship and conflict management Strong negotiation skills with experience in contract management for IT services Navigating tricky situations with tact and respect yielding positive results Strategic thinking and creative problem solving along with being adaptable Detail orientation, creativity Availability to navigate dense, complex documents and then advocate for your business Communication and collaboration skills Fluency in English required Benefits Canteen Childcare Flexible work practices More about us ABB Turbocharging (www.abb.com/turbocharging) is at the helm of the global industry in the manufacture and maintenance of turbochargers for 500 kW to 80+ MW diesel and gas engines. Approximately 200.000 ABB turbochargers are in operation across the globe on ships, power stations, gen-sets, diesel locomotives and large, off-highway vehicles. November 19, 2020, ABB announced the planned divestment of its Turbocharging Division. Turbocharging is a successful and profitable Division in a mature market and has been for long a highly self-reliant business within ABB. ABB has decided to take this step, acknowledging that for Turbocharging to realize its full potential going forward, a new setup is required. As the next step, alternative ownership options, including a spin-off to the Swiss stock market, will be assessed, considering value for customers, ABB and the future of the turbocharging business. The recruiting process is being led by Elina Seibold, Talent Partner ABB Switzerland Ltd. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com. Ringier is a diversified media company with about 7,300 employees across 19 countries. Founded in 1833, Ringier manages leading brands in print, TV, radio, online and mobile media and runs successful print, entertainment and internet businesses. In a history that spans more than 180 years, Ringier stands for a pioneering spirit, independence, freedom of expression and diversity of information. Ringier is a Swiss family-owned business with head offices in Zurich. Ringier Data Technology Department is part of the Ringier International Technology and Data Unit, driving our customer data platform "Star" (formerly known as Sherlock) for personalization, cross-brand recommendation, and monetization. To further accelerate the development and adoption of the award-winning data platform, the DataTech department is recruiting a: Data Engineer 80-100% (f/m/d) Role and Responsibilities Analyze data of online customers across Ringier's Brands and make user behavior and intent comprehensible for business stakeholders Collaborate within a cross-functional international team to design and implement data engineering solutions Be comfortable with using PySpark based tooling for your daily routine Learn additional skills to design complex data processing and machine learning pipelines Communicate and collaborate with stakeholders in German and English Education and Experience Proficiency in Python and SQL, possibly Java or Scala Knowledge of PySpark for distributed computation Proven knowledge of development best practices Experience with Agile methodology and problem- centric solution design A pragmatic mindset, not afraid of making mistakes, and learning from them Fluency in German and English Benefits Work in a lean, agile and highly motivated team of international data engineers Work on state of the art data engineering framework Flexible place of work Bring in your own ideas and be part of the decision making Interessed?

Today Lonza is a global leader in life sciences. Key responsibilities: Responsible for providing timely and accurate translation of customer needs into proposals of time, cost and quality Create project proposals, timelines, plans, quotations and pricing by coordinating and working with multiple technical and operational groups Ensure good understanding of customer requests and technical project needs Assess feasibility as well as agree activities, resources, costs (including CAPEX) and timelines Transcribe proposals into asset, resource and financial planning systems as appropriate Provide value proposition, price and T&Cs to Sales in interaction with Commercial Development Work with operational groups and finance to ensuring the planned and actual scope are as accurate as possible Attend and lead customer meetings (on or off site) Key requirements: Significant industry experience in a Pharmaceutical company with parenteral Drug Product (formulation or process) development, analytics and/or manufacture Substantial knowledge of clinical product development and commercialization of parenteral Drug Products as well as customer facing experience Demonstrated ability to manage multiple, scientific projects and make sound scientific and regulatory interpretations and judgments Proficiency in English required, German language skills beneficial Extensive experience of program / project management within a scientific environment Ability to identify creative commercial, workable solutions Proven persuasive communication skills in a highly scientific and technical environment Diplomacy, negotiation skills, independent work skills, strong work ethic Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast paced, pressured environment Every day, Lonzas products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences.

Basic Info Location Baden, Aargau, Switzerland Job type Full-Time Contract Regular/Permanent Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. You will be active for the railway segment, working in conjunction and close cooperation with ABB local sales and tendering organization of the countries. Through your activity you will promote the ABB portfolio and solutions to railway stakeholders (EPCs’, system integrators, consulting companies, railway and urban transportation operators) in order to achieve ABB market penetration and growth aspirations. Reporting to the Global Marketing and Sales Railway Manager, you will develop railway solutions starting from the pursuing stage to make ABB offering more attractive and competitive. Your responsibilities Guarantee railway application technical competence in order to be identified as a railway ex-pert within ABB organization and a recognized competent counterpart by customers Lead offers’ preparation in coordination with the bid and proposal department of the offering unit: ensure that the technical and financial aspects of offers are properly assessed, including prices and trading conditions Guarantee that technical and commercial offers are in compliance with tender documents as well as customer’s inquiries and specifications Lead internal approval process for demanding opportunities Ensure regular follow-up with ongoing opportunities in close cooperation with the colleagues of the GMS Railway and the entire organization Actively take part in initiatives for capturing opportunities at the early stage, develop technical solutions in order to influence end-user specifications Maintain and enhance customer satisfaction by providing excellent service at all stages of the sales process Your background Masters in Electrical engineering 5 years of professional experience for tendering in MV and LV IEC equipment. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com. The recruiting process is being led by Stephan Kuehne, Talent Partner ABB Switzerland Ltd. Die Liebherr-Components AG mit Sitz in Nussbaumen in der Schweiz ist als Handelsgesellschaft zuständig für den weltweiten Vertrieb von Komponenten und Systemlösungen der Firmengruppe Liebherr auf dem Gebiet der mechanischen, hydraulischen und elektrischen Antriebs- und Steuerungstechnik. Ihre Aufgabe Sie bearbeiten Ersatzteilanfragen und -angebote für Komponenten von Liebherr und übernehmen die Verantwortung für die Abwicklung der Ersatzteilbestellungen Sie kümmern sich um die Disposition und Terminüberwachung, die Koordination der Logistik und Fakturierung Die Steigerung der Kundenzufriedenheit liegt Ihnen am Herzen, Sie fördern die Kundenbindung Selbständig erledigen Sie die allgemeine Korrespondenz mit Kunden und Lieferanten Sie führen enge Kontakte mit Lieferanten sowie internen Stellen und übernehmen die Koordination Sie pflegen die Ersatzteil-Preise und Rabatte (Stammdatenpflege) Sie prüfen und bearbeiten Gewährleistungsanträge (gemäß Vertragsbedingungen) Sie bearbeiten und verrechnen Schulungen, Serviceleistungen und Reparaturen Sie optimieren die Kundenintegration in die Digital Service Lösungen der Liebherr Gruppe (z.B. Roche v-TAC is a software component that calculates arterial blood gas values from peripheral venous blood, supplemented with arterial oxygen saturation (SpO2) measured by pulse oximetry. Definition of analytical performance specifications for v-TAC Study planning and statistical evaluations according Clinical & Laboratory Standards Institute (CLSI) guidelines Lead of internal analytical performance studies and support of external analytical performance studies The Technical Project Leader leads these activities in a cross-functional team: Coordination of all system integration activities within R&D Continuous collaboration and coordination with Business Area, Clinical Science, Clinical Operations, Design Quality, Regulatory and Biostatistics Reporting to BA project team Key requirements: Master’s degree or PhD in Chemistry, Biology, Physics or related natural and technical sciences Passionate personality who networks well and drives this project with the System Integration team and with peers and stakeholders Ability to drive conclusions and decisions with peers and stakeholders Leadership experience in matrix organizations Experience in creation of development-, verification & validation- and submission documents according CLSI guidelines and fulfilling regulatory needs Fluent English language skills, German language skills would be a plus Roche is an equal opportunity employer.

ber uns H&M bietet dir ein sich schnell entwickelndes Arbeitsumfeld, in dem du mit Kunden und Kollegen interagierst. Warum H&M? Dienstjahr Dienstaltersprmie nach 10 Dienstjahren HIP-Programm (H&M-Dienstaltersbonus-Programm) Kostenlose externe Beratung durch Movis bei persnlichen und privaten Problemen Die H&M-Gruppe behlt sich das Recht vor, einen oder mehrere dieser Vorteile ohne Vorankndigung zu ndern oder einzustellen. Équipé des appareils de démonstration Hilti, vous identifiez les besoins de nos clients de manière ciblée et vous leur présentez la valeur ajoutée des produits et solutions Hilti directement sur place. Une grande partie des diplômés commencent leur carrière chez Hilti dans le secteur de la distribution se préparant ainsi à leur carrière future de manager, spécialiste ou chef de projet. 93% de nos employées sont fiers de travailler chez Hilti. Vous êtes convaincus que chez Hilti, vous voulez apprendre la vente directe en fond de comble. Über uns H&M bietet dir ein sich schnell entwickelndes Arbeitsumfeld, in dem du mit Kunden und Kollegen interagierst. Warum H&M? Wenn du einen Job bei H&M antrittst, startest du mit einem Onboarding-Plan, damit du in deiner neuen Rolle Erfolg hast. Ausserdem wirst du während deiner gesamten Karriere bei H&M Unterstützung in deiner beruflichen und persönlichen Entwicklung erhalten. Dienstjahr Dienstaltersprämie nach 10 Dienstjahren HIP-Programm (H&M-Dienstaltersbonus-Programm) Kostenlose externe Beratung durch Movis bei persönlichen und privaten Problemen Die H&M-Gruppe behält sich das Recht vor, einen oder mehrere dieser Vorteile ohne Vorankündigung zu ändern oder einzustellen. Bei H&M ist jeder Tag anders, aber hier kannst du sehen, wie ein solcher Tag aussehen kann: Sicherstellung eines hervorragenden Kundenservice auf der Verkaufsfläche, in den Kabinen und an der Kasse Ankurbelung des Umsatzes durch hervorragende Kenntnisse unseres Sortiments und unserer technischen Tools, mit denen du unsere Kunden beim Einkaufen im Store und im Onlineshop unterstützt Aufrechterhaltung einer guten Teamarbeit und aktive Unterstützung deiner Kollegen Sicherstellung einer attraktiven Warenpräsentation und einer nachhaltigen Warenpflege sowie Annahme und Verarbeitung unserer Lieferungen Befolgung unserer Store-Routinen und Richtlinien zur Unterstützung der Schadensprävention und Sicherheit und zur Sicherstellung eines attraktiven Stores Umsetzung der Kassen-Routinen und -Transaktionen, Verkaufskampagnen, Reduktionen und Preisänderungen sowie Anbringung von Sicherheitsetiketten an den Artikeln Qualifikationen Du bist kunden- und dienstleistungsorientiert und hast Spass am Verkaufen.

At Roche, 94,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. The program will enable simplified, standardized, and harmonized global business processes by using SAP, Life Science Industry and Roche best practices. The Engagement and Change Management Lead will be a key role working closely with the ASPIRE Program team and Roche ERP Leadership team to achieve a true step change in how ASPIRE transformation is delivered into Roche to improve the business benefits and reduce the TCO of the ERP systems for Roche. The Engagement and Change Management Lead role will be a strategic role and be directly accountable for leading comprehensive bottom-up assessment of transformation and change management opportunities and capabilities and working with the ASPIRE IT and Roche ERP teams to structure and size the opportunities to deliver the results of ASPIRE to Roche. Your primary responsibilities include: Strong collaboration with ASPIRE Program team, Workstream leads and Project team members Define the ASPIRE IT engagement and change management roadmaps and strategies Define and lead the transformation governance Lead the transformation team (communication, OCM, training) to a high performing team delivering on its commitments Manage the IT transformation capability (change management, training, communication) accelerating transformation and value creation to drive toward the expected outcomes Support the change delivery of ASPIRE program and projects You bring the following qualifications: Masters, MBA degree level or equivalent in business or IT Proven track record of successfully managing large scale global ERP/ SAP transformations +10 years of experience in Organizational Change Management, Training, Communication and Coaching Background in ERP project management, focusing on implementation projects, typically in the area of Lifesciences and IT Demonstrated ability to influence and foster collaborative relationships with ability to engage resources outside of direct-control to gain consensus, meet deadlines and achieve goals and objectives stakeholders in a highly complex cross-functional, global environment Outstanding communication skills are essential with the ability to communicate credibly and effectively on appropriate details level, across the program team from technology oriented team members, internal executives in Program Leadership and sponsors Excellent leadership (VACC), management and interpersonal skills in large enterprise as well as experience in delivering projects using Roche project management methodology (PMM) or equivalent Prior experience with SAP Solution Manager is desirable Are you ready to apply? We are looking for someone who thinks beyond the job offered - someone who knows that this position can be a rare springboard to many other opportunities at Roche. Roche is an equal opportunity employer.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION Eligible for Employee Referral Bonus: Yes #LI-PFE Sunshine Act Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care providers name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. EEO & Employment Eligibility Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer.

Roches Clinical Development organization is structured by therapeutic area and is responsible for developing and executing the late development (Phase IB III) clinical strategies and plans that deliver medically differentiated therapies that provide meaningful improvement to patients. Cross Functional Team Leadership: A key member of the Lifecycle Teams LT (GDL, LCL and IBL), representing Product Development (PD) Leads cross-functional, fit-for-purpose team(s) with a focus on product development, molecule or disease strategy (Development Working Groups, Clinical Science Team CST, as appropriate and assigned by the LCT LT) Represents PD/CD for assigned portfolio at the highest management/expert levels inside and outside Roche; includes championing and sponsoring the work of his/her staff Represents PD/CD on cross-functional strategic workstreams and initiatives as well as with internal (REDs, PD functions) and external (Business Development, Partnering, Scientific and Medical Societies, Therapeutic Area Experts, Regulatory Authorities) interactions Oversees multiple Clinical Development Plans (CDPs), disease strategies, molecules and/or indications, as well as associated clinical trial programs and studies. Supports his/her direct reports and/or other CD staff members in their communications and interactions with these external parties Works across Roche at all levels and with various groups and functions, such as other groups in PD, research, business development, manufacturing, commercial operations, legal, etc. Serves on joint executive committees, which include other Roche functions as well as external partner personnel, and/or assigns such responsibilities to direct reports Leads global CD strategy development for the assigned portfolio. Acts as a regular reviewer/presenter to various internal committees Acts as an expert advisor and consultant to various internal committees, other Roche management and teams regarding CD strategies, priorities, implementation and the like. Demonstrates, or proven abilities to demonstrate, Roche Values Clinical leadership: is recognized as a subject matter expert in his/her field (includes external recognition as an expert); able to evaluate, interpret and present highly complex data for a series of studies (prospective and retrospective); has made significant contributions to an organizations drug development (whether for Roche or another organization); has identified and created clinical development strategies that have led to label-enabling product definitions Has demonstrated outstanding leadership of multiple development projects and teams Proven abilities to plan and resource multiple development projects on short-, medium- and longer-term bases Outstanding organizational and time management skills; proven abilities to manage multiple, often complex and sometimes competing, objectives, goals and other priorities to effective and efficient conclusion Strategic agility: has in-depth knowledge and broad experience in the pharma/biotech industry and is able to bring this to bear in accomplishing strategic goals and objectives Outstanding judgment and decision-making skills; past results are indicative of consistently sound and effective business decisions Considerable comfort around all levels of management; has regularly demonstrated the managerial courage necessary to succeed at higher-levels within the organization Outstanding interpersonal skills; proven track record of building strong and sustainable relationships with internal & external partners/stakeholders Strong influencing skills; proven abilities to get things done without formal authority Strong negotiation skills; is highly adept at identifying solutions that will meet the needs of all parties involved Strong communication & presentation skills; exhibits professional maturity, confidence and competence. Knows how to summarize and communicate the key points and business case for others to effectively and expeditiously make important business decisions Strong conflict management skills; proactively minimizes situations where conflict may arise Strong conflict resolution skills; proven abilities to effectively and expeditiously reach satisfactory resolution among all involved parties Outstanding financial acumen: has a proven track record of achieving qualitative and quantitative results across multiple, often large-scale and complex clinical development projects Ability to travel globally ( Drug Development Expertise Scientific Expertise Medical Expertise Disease Expertise Leadership Strategic Agility Innovator and Competitive mindset Creative Mindset Collaboration and Communication Portfolio/Enterprise View #ASH20 Roche is an equal opportunity employer.

employer_description: Competitive Intelligence (CI) is a team of strategists with diverse backgrounds within GLIDE that synthesizes medical, scientific, and commercial information from the external environment to drive decision-making for the Roche/Genentech portfolio. Job Description In this position, with minimal guidance from more senior members of the team, you will be primarily accountable for consistently and effectively: Being an expert in leading key competitor monitoring and analysis Ability to identify shifting standards of care, emerging development trends, and potential opportunities for future development for our molecules Recognition of emergent agents, MoAs, platforms, and modalities to identify threats and opportunities Ability to accurately forecast competitor launch timelines and probabilities, identify critical competitors and data Lead or influence key internal development and commercialization decisions Drive translation of competitive findings into business recommendations that deliver success for the organization Data expert to assure that impactful, actionable competitor information and Roche product differentiation is identified and taken into account during key decisions via strategic workshops or other venues Identify opportunities to improve high-level pharma portfolio strategy or Roche organization structure and decision-making by drawing on case examples or other information from the external environment Actively identifying CI information, data collection, and insight communication to varied stakeholders Based on knowledge of impending strategic decisions, identify available data sources, collect competitive intelligence, and synthesize information for commercial, medical, and scientific leaders Manage external vendor relationships for collection and structuring of CI data including planning and execution of CI at medical/scientific conferences Comply with all laws, regulations and policies that govern the ethical conduct of Roche activities Collaborating with many other functions Ensure cross functional stakeholder alignment within the Therapeutic Area / Business Franchise in support of CI initiatives and deliverables and ensure alignment with broader GLIDE Partnering across GPS, Medical, Product Development, REDs, Partnering, and other functions Supporting CI team growth Identification and execution of ways to improve the work processes of CI and grow the group’s impact within the organization Qualifications - Internal Bachelor’s Degree (life sciences or related discipline is a plus); MBA, MD, or PhD in a life sciences, technical, or analytical discipline is preferred Complex strategic project leadership experience in a matrixed environment--specific examples of influence in strategy decisions will be required Fluency in written and spoken English is required Prior experience in CI preferred It is also preferred that the candidate has at least 1 of the following qualifications: 2 or more years of corporate strategy, financial/investment analysis, venture capital, management consulting, or strategic planning experience in the biopharma industry Experience with projects leading biopharma teams through complex strategic decisions by synthesizing and incorporating competitor information Other deep experience pharmaceutical product discovery, development, or commercialization | CIM Position This is an individual contributor position located in Basel, Denmark, the UK as well as coast-coast US. Functional Information Security & Privacy Expert Who we are At Roche, 94,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. The Position Roche has embarked on a comprehensive Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) initiative - ASPIRE - to integrate all core processes across Finance, Procurement and Technical Operations needed to run a company into a single, transparent and efficient system using the latest SAP ERP technology. The Functional Information Security & Privacy Expertis responsible for the execution of the Roche Group Information Security Management System within Roche ERP for the ASPIRE Program. The Roche Information Security Management System (ISMS) is a framework of policies, directives, standards, guidelines, processes and organizational capabilities designed to maintain compliance with security standards, laws and regulations to ensure Roche's right to operate. The Global Information Security & Privacy Governance Organization is accountable for the ISMS and is the 2nd line-of-control for the Roche Group. Your responsibilities include: Close collaboration with the Global Information Security & Privacy organisation and participation in a network of Information Security & Privacy Representatives from across the Roche Group. RepresentRoche ERP and IT ASPIRE in Global Information Security & Privacy programs for continuous improvement to the global ISMS. In addition, you bring the following qualifications: An interest in privacy and security topics with proven knowledge in governance, risk and compliance and relevant legal and regulatory standards in the healthcare industry Good understanding of Information Technology, new trends in IT and their impact on ISEC and privacy Ability to advise and influence all levels of the organization Ability to work within a Federated Security & Privacy Governance Model with the Group Information Security & Privacy organization Serve as first-line-of-control in collaboration with Group Information Security & Privacy organization as second-line-of-control Ability to collaborate with a broad community of security and privacy practitioners Excellent oral and written communication skills in English Please apply until 14.08.2020 Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. If you still have questions then please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq. Roche is an equal opportunity employer.

At Roche, we believe its urgent to deliver medical solutions right now even as we develop innovations for the future. Roche Pharma Research and Early Development (pRED) Ophthalmology is in constant evolution. We are now offering a Roche Clinical Fellowship program. You will be working with a group of Ophthalmologists, scientists, PhD students and Postdocs in the Ophthalmology Department within Roche Pharma Research and Early Development (pRED) in Basel, Switzerland. You will gain valuable knowledge, contacts and opportunities to further your career.Roche was voted Times Top 100 Best Companies to Work for 2019 The Roche pRED Ophthalmology Clinical Fellowship is a new flagship program designed to diversify and broaden clinical training through exposure to clinical research methodology from the pharmaceutical medicine perspective. The fellowship will be 1 year in duration, primarily based within the Ophthalmology Translational Medicine Group at the Roche Headquarters in Basel, Switzerland. Over many years Roche has generated a wealth of clinical databases from clinical trials and patient registries. Duration 1 year temporary contract Location: Roche main campus, Basel Collaborations between pharmaceutical companies, the health service and academia are key to improving patient outcomes and care Understanding drug development, regulation and the reimbursement process is critical for physicians wishing to influence the delivery of healthcare Our fellowships offer a unique insight training for those wishing to participate or conduct clinical trials in their future careers Abundant scope for research opportunities using large impactful datasets and the chance to work with key opinion leaders Are you ready to apply? Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. If you still have questions then please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq. Roche is an equal opportunity employer.
